content:
Did you try the method suggested here?

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1493765#answer-1712770
creator: sfhowes

content:
sfhowes, thanks for responding! What I found in the above link was:

Open Thunderbird, Go to Settings-General; at the bottom of that section you'll find a button for Config editor; click on that and search for this line: widget.non-native-theme.scrollbar.style; click on the edit button on the far right of that line and change the 0 to something like 28 and hit the enter key on your keyboard. The change should become instantaneous, but you may need to close and re-open Thunderbird. 28 seems to be a fairly decent size, but you can adjust it as necessary to suit your needs.

I tried that, but it had absolutely no effect on my scrollbar width, even with a setting of 50 instead of the 28 referenced. I found another reference to making the scrollbars always visible, which I also found and checked, and then restarted Thunderbird. But the changes did not take effect. Is there another setting that would be effective?

Thanks again.
creator: wmichaelb

content:
The preference widget.non-native-theme.scrollbar.style takes the value 0 - 5, and choosing 4 is the widest, at least here in W11.

https://www.reddit.com/r/Thunderbird/comments/1fz9f5j/comment/lr02b8z/

https://support.mozilla.org/gl/questions/1503077#answer-1722732

I don't have Linux to test, so try that and report on the results.

The colours can be set with this code in userChrome.css and userContent.css: 

:root {scrollbar-color: orange denim !important;}
creator: sfhowes

content: sfhowes, that worked, thank you very much! I did try that number at first, but for some reason it did not work then. But this width is a big help.
creator: wmichaelb

content:
Michele Thompson said
Good Morning! I hope this message finds you well. I have been using the Mozilla family of products for a long time. One feature that I do miss is the ability to make my emails special by adding backgrounds into them. If this feature is still available please advise on how to get this done because I can not find a way to do this. If this feature isn't still available please bring it back. I miss it greatly especially during the holidays. It gives the holiday emails a little bit extra. Thank you for your time! Michele Thompson (user since approximately 2005)

In the Write window, click in the message body, select Format/Page Colours and Background... Choose File... to browse to the image (see picture). Press Alt if the Menu Bar with Format is hidden.

content:
I do have to wonder exactly what you have done to even have a spam folder as yahoo does not have an IMAP folder called SPAM. Regardless of what they display in their web interfaces.

That your junk folder is in the trash folder, that s also probably a good location for it, but before deleting it you probably needed to remove the entry in account settings > junk that says it is is the location to move junk mail. (it sets to folders special flag that gives he folder the flamer icon and also makes it the location used for Thunderbird's junk mail processing where Thunderbird puts what it considers to be junk mail.

Yahoo, for reasons only understood by the corporate bankers running the company, uses the label Bulk or Bulk Mail for the IMAP spam folder name. This is reported to Thunderbird by the Yahoo server, it is not something Thunderbird makes up. Why use different names in the web interface and IMAP, refer back to my bankers idea. I have no clue and no one I have ever asked about it has one either. So you should be seeing a folder in the subscribe area (right click the account in the folder pane names bulk or bulk mail. subscribe to it. Modify the thunderbird account settings for copies and folders and junk settings to use the same folder
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
The picture shows the schedule for Firefox. There is no version of TB above 115 that supports OS X 10.13.

https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/releases/
creator: sfhowes

content:
I was using Firefox ESR's new schedule as an example. Firefox ESR updates had originally ended but Mozilla decided to add at least 6 more months of updates Firefox ESR 115.28 through 115.33. The question is if something similar either HAD happened or WAS going to happen with T-bird ESR 115.18.

Apparently you are as in the dark as I am about the possibility. Hopefully someone more knowledgeable than both of us might chime in here.
creator: romad

content:
If the Thunderbird community was going to keep the old Tb 115 ESR updated with security and stability updates then they would have continued with updates past the Tb 115.18.0esr.

Mozilla Thunderbird is developed by MZLA Technologies Corporation, which is a wholly-owned, for-profit subsidiary of the Mozilla Foundation.

Firefox 115 ESR was originally going to end as of Fx 115.15.0esr but then Mozilla decided to continue extensions of updates since as this time is the third updates extension.
creator: James

content: your post is vague. Here are some thoughts: gmail and outlook automatically save to sent folder. if you have thunderbird set to do that, I suggest UNticking it to eliminate saving twice. that may resolve your issue.
creator: davidsk

content: If you don't need to access sent messages on other devices, you could set the target for sent mail to Local Folders (if sent messages aren't automatically saved). To save space, define a filter as in the attached picture and run it manually on the folder with sent messages.
